channel.title: ~~Helping with few things, most common things~~
channel.description:
[size=15pt][b]Please leave a comment so that I know you read these helpful things![/b][/size]
[glow=yellow,2,300]Well I am here to help you. I know a few things (ex: adding commands, editing items from shops, connecting to server, and lots more) If you have other questions, feel free to Message me or add me. Kousinzack92@earthlink.net (thats my msn) or kousinzackk1992 (thats my AIM) If I cant help you, im sorry about that! Well I made tuts, which I will post here because I see alot of this asking for these.[/glow] [b]~~The First F.A.Q~~ How Do I Connect To A Server? Read this, and you will find out![/b] [i][b]-----Getting on a server-----
=-=-=Hamachi Servers=-=-= First you will need hamachi, as most servers you need to have this to connect. www.hamachi.cc and find download. Click download and download the installer. Install the installer and you should have hamachi, or for short, HAM. When you open this file up, it should say "This is your first time using hamachi" or something along the lines of that. Follow the tutorial until you get to the end. Now the customized things come in. Now in the post on whatever forum you use, you should have at least 3 inportant details, the IP of the server; the HAM Network name; and the HAM password. You must fill these into your HAM so you can connect. Go down the bottom of the HAM window and click the middle button, the trianglular shape button. A scroll bar sort of thing should appear with join or create. You need to join. I need to put down an example, sorry, but it is going to be my server!
Ok for the top box, you have to type in, BobScape (Thats the name of the HAM name)
Ok for the bottom box, you have to type in, bob (Thats the password for the HAM network)
Press Enter. If you did this correctly, the box should disappear and in your HAM window, you should see BobScape with a few names under it. If you don't, repeat the window with the HAM name and the the HAM password. Find the name BobScape or the name of the "Scape" you are trying to enter near one of those names. If you cannot find one, search the server thread again, it may be in there. But if there is one there right-click it and click the one saying "Copy IP address." Skip the NO-IP and go to the one after it.
=-=-=NO-IP=-=-= This method is much easier than the first method. Now, you may come across a server thread with no HAM details in it at all. This is called a NO-IP server. This is where the owner/hoster of the server likes to have words in the server IP and no HAM. Usually, they will give you the IP address, which, as I said, is words. And, again, I need an example, and lucky, it's dipsetscape.no-ip.info You only have to have that and you can go to the next step.
-=-=Connection to the actual server=-=-= Now, the final step, now we need a client, MoparScape. You can download it from http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,6915.msg70691.html You should read that whole post, but if you are too lazy too, you have to download from the link provided there. Extract it to wherever, My Documents, My Desktop, just remember where you put it. Go to the file and find Moparscape, right-click it, and click extract here. It should extract and you get a folder with Moparscape on it. Double-click it and go into runMoparscape.bat or Moparscape.jar. But if you are lazy to do all that! Go to www.moparisthebest.com That's the webclient it is exactly the same. (Thats the one I use. Way easier!) So open up moparscape file and run that or go to www.moparisthebest.com and it should load everything, now you have two buttons on the screen, in the middle of the page, one is Enter, the other is Start Server. You need to click start server and wait for the cache loads. It only has to download once, so next time you click it, it will go instantly. After all that click "OK" and you should be back to main menu. Go to File in the top-left corner, click new server, ok Hamachi users, you need to get into that window by going down to the task bar. When done, you have to copy the IP address, if you have NO IDEA of what I am talking about, go back to the set-up of HAM. After copying the IP address go back to your Moparscape and past it there...Ctrl+V and the server IP should come up. Press Ok and start server. For NO-IP users, go into the server thread and find the IP address which is in words. Copy and paste that into the New Server window click Ok and start server. Now both HAM and NO-IP click enter and you should see Username, Password, Server IP. enter your wanted username is where? The username line. And the password in the password line. LEAVE THE SERVER IP. Do not use the same Username and password than your real runescape account. You could any original name you like and dont put your password as "dfgsfd" you need to be able to remember it.
Click the enter, login button and you should be logging into a server. If it says error. COnsult the owner/hoster if it is online, or offline. Ask what port it is. If it is different from 43594 (like mine) you have to go file, new port, the port the owner/hoster told you, ok, start server, ok, enter, login. If not you could have had had a mental breakdown and did the tutorial wrong.
Thanks for reading, downloading and coming to our forums, the best around, Moparscape!
Made over a period of half an hour, finished at 5:24 PM 8/12/2006 AEST.
COPYRIGHT LoosyLoo Josh BobScape 100% NOT ME[/b][/i]
[b]~~The Second F.A.Q~~ How Do I Edit An Items Bonus/stats? Read this and you will find out![/b]
[b]Purpose:[/b] [i]So that you know how to edit an items bonuses.[/i]
[b]Difficulty:[/b] [i]2(easier)[/i]
[b]Assumed Knowledge:[/b] [i]How to open a file, and how to change it to a number.[/i]
[b]Server Base:[/b] [i]Pur3PkScape- Pimpscape[/i]
[b]Classes Modified:[/b] [i]Item.cfg[/i]
[b][u]Procedure[/u][/b] [i]Open item.cfg[/i] [i]Then do you see like things like this?[code]item = 4214 Crystal_bow_full A_nice_sturdy_magical_bow. 505512.837455532 505512.837455532 699539.568589636 0 0 0 0 109 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 [/code][i]See all those 0s, and the 109? Well i got the solution for you! [b]Now listen closely, you cannot edit these without know what zero is what bonus here is what each zero stands for!!! [/b] [b]FIRST FIVE NUMBERS = ALL ATTACK BONUSES[/b] 1st number = stab att bonus 2nd number = slash att bonus 3rd number = crush att bonus 4th number = magic att bonus 5th number = range att bonus
[b]NOW THEN THE NEXT FIVE NUMBERS = ALL DEFENSE BONUSES[/b] 6th number = stab def bonus 7th number = slash def bonus 8th number = crush def bonus 9th number = magic def bonus 10th number = range def bonus
[b]THE LAST TWO NUMBERS = STRENGTH AND PRAYER BONUSES[/b] 11th number = strength bonus 12th number = prayer bonus[/i]
[i]So, just edit the numbers to what you want![/i]
[b]Credits:[/b] [i]100% Me, Unless somebody made this tutorial before me.[/i] [b][i]Enjoy this TUT![/i][/b]
[b]~~The Last F.A.Q.~~ Where Do I Get Lists For Items, Objects, Etc? Look at bottom for attachments of some, and below this are some that couldn't fit in the attachments.[/b]
[size=15pt][glow=blue,2,300]Hey, for all you people looking for an Emote List and other list? Well, I got some right here for all of you! Now you don't have to ask for them anymore! Please look towards the end of this post to download the lists! [shadow=red,left]Thanks and Have a Nice Day,[/shadow] Zachary825 P.S. Merry Christmas & a Happy New Year![/glow][/size] ALSO Heres some more lists that I had, couldn't fit with others so here it is!

List: 360-370 - ancients ice spells 370-380 - ancients blood spells 380-390 - ancients shadow/smoke spells 57 - port cullus going down 58 - port cullus lifting up 59 - whirlpool 61 - log on chain swinging lol 155-172 - normal combat spells 245 - stars above head 284 - dragon hally special 435 - electricity thing 346 - explosion 501 - ice thing 392 - ancient magicks teleport!!! 396 - wierd blue spell 393 - wierd fire thing 394 - wierd green thing 395 - wierd ice thing 400 - karils anti agility attack 361 - ice burst failing 363 - ice burst (being attacked) 364 - giant ice block (not in real rs ancient magicks) 365 - giant ice block (not in real rs ancient magicks) 367 - ice blitz (being attacked) 366/368 - ice blitz (casting) 369 - ice barrage 370 - huge ice block (not in real rs ancient magicks 0 - kbd fire 1 - fire 2 - white thing 3 - green thing 4 - purple rays 5 - moving purple rays 6 - sort of like teleporting 7 - sort of like teleporting 8 - vines? 9 - arrow 10 - arrow 11 - arrow 12 - arrow 13 - arrow 14 - arrow 15 - arrow 16 - ice arrow 17 - fire arrow 18 - moving arrow 19 - moving arrow 20 - moving arrow 21 - moving arrow 22 - moving arrow 23 - moving arrow 24 - moving arrow 25 - moving ice arrow 26 - moving fire arrow[/code] [code]The Interface List: 0 Thessalia's Makeovers [Legs] 139 Select an option 147 Player Controls 196 Player killing skull 200 Player killing skull 205 What would you like to enchant? 246 The Blueberry Cocktail Guide 247 Empty title bar 293 Left arrow 294 Right arrow 297 Quest Reward Scroll 328 Staff Equip 356 Single line text [click here to continue] 359 Two line text [click here to continue] 363 Three line text [click here to continue] 368 Four line text [click here to continue] 425 Warhammer equip 446 Ranging Minigame (target) 569 The Blueberry Cocktail Guide (Gnome?) 573 Right arrow 582 Gnome bowls, crunchies, battas 599 Blank menu bar 638 Quest journal 665 First the rows of emotes?... 671 Combination lock door 716 Combination lock door 719 Blank menu bar 776 Scythe equip 802 Map (Spirit trees, I think) 837 Book interface 840 Left arrow 842 Right arrow 865 Black menu bar 876 Draughts - Options 904 Game options (High detail) 962 Harp tab (High detail) 968 Chat text (Name, Line1, Click here to continue) 973 Chat text (Name, two lines , Click here to continue) 979 Chat text (Name, three lines , Click here to continue) 986 Chat text (Name, four lines , Click here to continue) 994 Smithing menu 1097 1 bar, Other" 1133 1 bar, studs 1136 Map of some sort 1151 Magic sidebar 1194 Spell description box 1644 Character equip tab 1668 Box showing bonuses 1689 Staff set (Ancient Magicks) 1690 Box (Spell descriptions) 1698 Battleaxe equip 1743 How many would you like to cook? 1749 Bow equips 1764 Bow equips 1779 Gianne's Cook Book 1787 Left arrow 188 Right arrow 1789 Blank menu bar 1829 Set a spell 1846 Spell description box 1908 Wilderness warning 2007 Hairdresser Salon (beard) 2505 Hairdresser Salon (hair [female]) 2156 Party Drop Chest 2276 Sword equip 2302 Cogs 2311 Leather crafting 2400 What would you like to smelt? (Smelt X) 2423 Sword Equip 2449 Log out sidebar 2459 Select and option [two options] 2465 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 2469 Select and option [three options] 2476 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 2480 Select and option four options] 2488 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 2492 Select and option [five options] 2501 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 2633 Hairdresser Salon (Hair [male]) 2808 Genie Lamp (skill select) 2834 Lock 2851 Thesselia's Makeover (torso [male]) 3023 Genie Lamp selection background 3038 Thesselia's Makeover (torso [female]) 3208 "You are the winner" 3209 Tzhaar View Choice 3213 Inventory 3236 6 Yellow outlines of squares 3249 Gear placement 3279 Tears of Guthix minigame 3281 Map (Karamja etc) 3323 Trade interface 3443 Trading confirmation 3559 Character design window 3702 Telescope view 3796 Mace equip 3824 Axe shop 3917 Skill sidebar 3918 First row of three skills 3925 Second row of three skills 3932 Third row of three skills 3939 Fourth row of three skills 3946 Fifth row of three skills 3953 Sixth row of three skills 3960 Quest points, combat level, total level 4148 Last row of skills 4161 What would you like to make? [Rings, Amulets, Necklaces) 4228 Ring mould in above interface 4161 4234 Necklace mould in above interface 4161 4340 Amulet mould in above interface 4161 4261 Advanced a thieving level 4262 Click the tune to play 6267 Advanced a runecrafting level 6272 Advanced a woodcutting level 6277 Advanced an Agility level 6282 Advanced a fire making level 4305 Clue scroll map 4416 Advanced a mining level 4429 How many would you like to make? 4443 Advanced a ranging level 4445 Game options (low detail) 4446 Throwing knives equip 4465 Deposit box 4471 Egyptian sliding puzzle 4504 Black hole? 4543 Barrows puzzle 4588 Book 4564 Trawler catch 4679 Spear Equip 4705 Sword Equip 4731 Thessalia's Makeovers (legs [female]) 4909 Reward (Certificate) 4919 Fraction Still 4970 Temple repair 5065 Friends list 5292 Bank 5392 Newcomer's map 5454 Select skin colour and gender 5570 Pickaxe equip 5596 Trawler instructions 5608 Prayer menu 5715 Ignore list 5855 Unarmed 5875 Report Abuse 6014 Unmoph 6028 List of needed items 6103 Handle equip 6152 Prison guard random event 6206 Advanced a Strength level 6211 Advanced a Magic level 6216 Advanced a hitpoints level 6221 Advanced a Smithing level 6226 Advanced a cooking level 6231 Advanced a Fletching level 6237 Advanced a Herblore level 6242 Advanced a Prayer level 6247 Advanced an Attack level 6253 Advanced a Defence level 6258 Advanced a Fishing level 6263 Advanced a Crafting level 6299 Low memory music tab 6308 Dueling scoreboard 6412 Are you sure you want to fight this duel? 6500 You are about to stake: 6501 Your opponent will stake: 6543 Mime emotes (chatbox) 6554 Mysterious box 6568 Maze random event 6575 Dueling with: 6665 Your stake: 6666 Opponent's stake 6667 Accept 6668 Decline 6672 Blank menu bar 6673 There is % of the reward left 6675 Dice? 6733 Dueling victory 6824 Claim 6946 Sextant 6960 Clue Reward 6965 Clue scroll 6984 Hint 7045 Clue map 7092 Lines on the clue scroll 7113 Clue map 7162 Clue map 7271 Clue map 7424 Bank pin 7762 Claws equip 8016 Grave monument 8030 Grave stone 8109 Hands holding a stone sign 8119 Black paper 8134 IfQuestName 8207 Select an Option [four options] 8215 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 8219 Select an Option [five options] 8228 Two swords facing inwards [chatbox] 8292 Brimhaven Agility Arena Ticket Exchange 8431 Claws, 2 bars 8460 Halberd equip 8511 Some puzzle thing 8559 More sophisticated version of 8511 8577 Crunchy (126) beat Crunchy (126)" 8680 Tutorial Island Process 8714 Skill menu [when you click on a skill that window pops up...] 8800 Empty box? 8813 Bronze \ Iron 8825 Steel 8825 Mithril 8828 Mithril 8838 Adamant 8841 Rune 8844 Smelting 8850 Op 8 8860 Op 9 8863 Op 10 8866 What would you like to make? 8880 What would you like to make? 8899 What would you like to make? 8938 What would you like to make? 9043 Clue Scroll 9108 Clue Scroll 9196 Clue Scroll 9275 Clue Scroll 9359 Clue Scroll 9454 Clue Scroll 9507 Clue Scroll 9632 Clue Scroll 9720 Clue Scroll 9839 Clue Scroll 9929 Orbit or something? 9947 Yrsa's Shoe Store 10051 Combination lock door 10054 Blank menu bar 10116 A face with runes around it? :\ 10245 Challenge 10258 Times per move 10266 Choose piece 10294 Challenge: Select Game 10360 Select 10371 Game <ranks> 10380 Draughts 10470 Resign 10507 Draughts 10597 Close 10617 Runelink[/code] [b][i]Credits: me for posting this, xerozcheez and whoever else made these.[/i][/b][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:51:21 AM[/size][hr][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:53:26 AM[/size][hr][b]~~The Fourth F.A.Q.~~ How Do I Get An Item To Go Into The Right Slot? Read this to find out![/b]
[b]Purpose[/b]: [i]So an item that you have goes into the right place, for example, if something should be in capes slot, its in weapon, etc.[/i]
[b]Difficulty[/b]: [i]2-Easier really.[/i]
[b]Assumed Knowledge[/b]: [i]Just knowing how to edit and delete some numbers, and pasting.[/i]
[b]Server Base[/b]: [i]Pur3PkScape- PIMPSCAPE[/i]
[b]Classes Modified[/b]: [i]Only Item.java[/i]
[b][u]Procedure[/u][/b] [i]First off, open your item.java(notepad one), and do you see at top where it says [code]public static int capes[], public static int boots[], public static int body[][/code] etc? well, all you do is post the item number in what you want. For Example, item 7336(rune kitesheild (h)), I put that into the public static int shields[] part. Then you compile, and login, and see if it worked. It should have worked, and your done! You can do that with any item! See how simple that was? Your finished![/i]
[b]Credits[/b]: [i]100% Me Unless somebody did this TUT before me.
[b]~~The Fifth F.A.Q.~~ How Do I Make A Weapon Not Dissappear Anymore, Or To Have A Different Emote To It? Read this![/b] [b]Purpose[/b]: This tut will show you how to make any weapon in your server hit with a different emote, and it will also show you how to make the weapon not dissappear if it already does. Example: When you attack something, you dont see the weapon attack, you see your fists. (like d mace, d scmitty, and d hally in pimpscape)
[b]Difficulty[/b]: 1
[b]Assumed Knowledge[/b]: Just CTRL+F and copy and pasting.
[b]Server Base[/b]: Pur3PkScape-Pimpscape source, will probably work with all of the sources.
[b]Classes Modified[/b]: Client.java
If your weapons dissappear in your server, and to change emotes to any weapon:
Open your Client.java
Search for: [code]if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4747) // torags hammers { return 2068; }[/code] You can add any weapon that dissapears. For example, see the 4747? That is the item ID number, so, if you want a dragon scmitty, copy the same thing under the last }, then edit 4747 to the item number of the weapon. For example, 6611, which is white scmitty. So edit 4747 to 6611. Then torags hammers to white scmitty. Then see that 2068? That is the emote the weapon uses. You can edit it to anything you want. You can edit it even to a barrows weapon! In my server, a dragon long is a flail! You see a dragon long, but hits like flail! For example, I have for my white scmitty in Pimpscape is this: [code]if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 6611) // white scmitty { return 3157; }[/code] That is the emote it will use the one shown(3157) is the dragon 2h special. If you do not see the weapon there, add it. If you add it, it will not dissappear in game. You can search for any weapon, and change the emote. Then save, and compile. Your done and the weapon don't dissappear and it has a different emote!! [b]Credits[/b]: 100% by me unless someone else did it before me. Enjoy this! Thank you.
[b]~~The Sixth F.A.Q.~~ How Do I Edit What XP I Get From Objects? (Specifically Ranged In Pimpscape) Read this for help![/b]
[b]Purpose[/b]: To make range faster when you hit the targets.
[b]Difficulty[/b]: 2-easy if you good coder, or just smart person=)
[b]Assumed Knowledge[/b]: CTRL+C and CTRL+V (copying and pasting, and a brain:p)
[b]Server Base[/b]: Pimpscape Source- Pur3PkScape.
[b]Classes Modified[/b]: Client.java, and thats all!
[b]Procedure[/b] Open Client.java, and search for:[code]case 2514:[/code] search it two times so you will see something like this: [code]case 2514: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target and get ALOT of XP."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426);[/code] Okay, when your there, delete all from case 2514(the target id number) all the way to the break;. So, copy all that, and delete and place this into it: [code]case 2514: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Thanks Zachary825 for fixing range."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((50000*playerLevel[4]), 4); addSkillXP((50000*playerLevel[18]), 18); addItem(1043, 10); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;[/code] The 50000 means how much xp you get(really gives more but lol) you can edit it higher or lower, depending on what you like. You can also do the same thing with dummies, hay bales, or doors. Basically anything if you know what your doing. Just right click the item(door, hay, or dummys) and go client and search case (item number of door etc here). Also you can edit the item it gives, the 1043 in the top if noted blue partyhars(10). You can also do this with prayer because its slow. Thats it, I hope you enjoyed this tut by Zachary825. [b]Credits[/b]: 100% by Zachary825, UNLESS somebody had this tut before mine, if they did tell me your name and I will post it here.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:54:16 AM[/size][hr]enjoy

item.title: ~~Helping with few things, most common things~~
item.dc:creator: @Zachary825 Zachary825
item.description:
@Zachary825 wrote:

[size=15pt]Please leave a comment so that I know you read these helpful things![/size]

[glow=yellow,2,300]Well I am here to help you. I know a few things (ex: adding commands, editing items from shops, connecting to server, and lots more)
If you have other questions, feel free to Message me or add me. Kousinzack92@earthlink.net (thats my msn) or kousinzackk1992 (thats my AIM) If I cant help you, im sorry about that!
Well I made tuts, which I will post here because I see alot of this asking for these.[/glow]
The First F.A.Q
How Do I Connect To A Server?
Read this, and you will find out!
[i][b]-----Getting on a server-----

=-=-=Hamachi Servers=-=-=
First you will need hamachi, as most servers you need to have this to connect.
www.hamachi.cc and find download.
Click download and download the installer.
Install the installer and you should have hamachi, or for short, HAM.
When you open this file up, it should say
“This is your first time using hamachi” or something along the lines of that.
Follow the tutorial until you get to the end.
Now the customized things come in.
Now in the post on whatever forum you use, you should have at least 3 inportant details, the IP of the server; the HAM Network name; and the HAM password.
You must fill these into your HAM so you can connect.
Go down the bottom of the HAM window and click the middle button, the trianglular shape button. A scroll bar sort of thing should appear with join or create. You need to join.
I need to put down an example, sorry, but it is going to be my server!

Ok for the top box, you have to type in, BobScape (Thats the name of the HAM name)

Ok for the bottom box, you have to type in, bob (Thats the password for the HAM network)

Press Enter. If you did this correctly, the box should disappear and in your HAM window, you should see BobScape with a few names under it. If you don’t, repeat the window with the HAM name and the the HAM password. Find the name BobScape or the name of the “Scape” you are trying to enter near one of those names. If you cannot find one, search the server thread again, it may be in there. But if there is one there right-click it and click the one saying “Copy IP address.” Skip the NO-IP and go to the one after it.

=-=-=NO-IP=-=-=
This method is much easier than the first method. Now, you may come across a server thread with no HAM details in it at all. This is called a NO-IP server. This is where the owner/hoster of the server likes to have words in the server IP and no HAM. Usually, they will give you the IP address, which, as I said, is words. And, again, I need an example, and lucky, it’s dipsetscape.no-ip.info You only have to have that and you can go to the next step.

-=-=Connection to the actual server=-=-=
Now, the final step, now we need a client, MoparScape. You can download it from http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,6915.msg70691.html
You should read that whole post, but if you are too lazy too, you have to download from the link provided there. Extract it to wherever, My Documents, My Desktop, just remember where you put it. Go to the file and find Moparscape, right-click it, and click extract here. It should extract and you get a folder with Moparscape on it. Double-click it and go into runMoparscape.bat or Moparscape.jar. But if you are lazy to do all that! Go to www.moparisthebest.com That’s the webclient it is exactly the same. (Thats the one I use. Way easier!) So open up moparscape file and run that or go to www.moparisthebest.com and it should load everything, now you have two buttons on the screen, in the middle of the page, one is Enter, the other is Start Server. You need to click start server and wait for the cache loads. It only has to download once, so next time you click it, it will go instantly. After all that click “OK” and you should be back to main menu. Go to File in the top-left corner, click new server, ok Hamachi users, you need to get into that window by going down to the task bar. When done, you have to copy the IP address, if you have NO IDEA of what I am talking about, go back to the set-up of HAM. After copying the IP address go back to your Moparscape and past it there…Ctrl+V and the server IP should come up. Press Ok and start server. For NO-IP users, go into the server thread and find the IP address which is in words. Copy and paste that into the New Server window click Ok and start server. Now both HAM and NO-IP click enter and you should see Username, Password, Server IP. enter your wanted username is where? The username line. And the password in the password line. LEAVE THE SERVER IP. Do not use the same Username and password than your real runescape account. You could any original name you like and dont put your password as “dfgsfd” you need to be able to remember it.

Click the enter, login button and you should be logging into a server. If it says error. COnsult the owner/hoster if it is online, or offline. Ask what port it is. If it is different from 43594 (like mine) you have to go file, new port, the port the owner/hoster told you, ok, start server, ok, enter, login. If not you could have had had a mental breakdown and did the tutorial wrong.

Thanks for reading, downloading and coming to our forums, the best around, Moparscape!

Made over a period of half an hour,
finished at 5:24 PM 8/12/2006 AEST.

COPYRIGHT
LoosyLoo
Josh
BobScape
100% NOT ME[/b][/i]

The Second F.A.Q
How Do I Edit An Items Bonus/stats?
Read this and you will find out!

Purpose: So that you know how to edit an items bonuses.

Difficulty: 2(easier)

Assumed Knowledge: How to open a file, and how to change it to a number.

Server Base: Pur3PkScape- Pimpscape

Classes Modified: Item.cfg

Procedure
Open item.cfg
[i]Then do you see like things like this?item = 4214 Crystal_bow_full A_nice_sturdy_magical_bow. 505512.837455532 505512.837455532 699539.568589636 0 0 0 0 109 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 [i]See all those 0s, and the 109? Well i got the solution for you!
Now listen closely, you cannot edit these without know what zero is what bonus here is what each zero stands for!!!
FIRST FIVE NUMBERS = ALL ATTACK BONUSES
1st number = stab att bonus
2nd number = slash att bonus
3rd number = crush att bonus
4th number = magic att bonus
5th number = range att bonus

NOW THEN THE NEXT FIVE NUMBERS = ALL DEFENSE BONUSES
6th number = stab def bonus
7th number = slash def bonus
8th number = crush def bonus
9th number = magic def bonus
10th number = range def bonus

THE LAST TWO NUMBERS = STRENGTH AND PRAYER BONUSES
11th number = strength bonus
12th number = prayer bonus[/i]

So, just edit the numbers to what you want!

Credits: 100% Me, Unless somebody made this tutorial before me.
Enjoy this TUT!

The Last F.A.Q.
Where Do I Get Lists For Items, Objects, Etc?
Look at bottom for attachments of some, and below this are some that couldn’t fit in the attachments.

[size=15pt][glow=blue,2,300]Hey, for all you people looking for an Emote List and other list? Well, I got some right here for all of you! Now you don’t have to ask for them anymore! Please look towards the end of this post to download the lists!
[shadow=red,left]Thanks and Have a Nice Day,[/shadow]
Zachary825
P.S. Merry Christmas & a Happy New Year![/glow][/size]

Credits: me for posting this, xerozcheez and whoever else made these.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:51:21 AM[/size][hr][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:53:26 AM[/size][hr]The Fourth F.A.Q.
How Do I Get An Item To Go Into The Right Slot?
Read this to find out!

Purpose: So an item that you have goes into the right place, for example, if something should be in capes slot, its in weapon, etc.

Difficulty: 2-Easier really.

Assumed Knowledge: Just knowing how to edit and delete some numbers, and pasting.

Server Base: Pur3PkScape- PIMPSCAPE

Classes Modified: Only Item.java

Procedure
First off, open your item.java(notepad one), and do you see at top where it says public static int capes[], public static int boots[], public static int body[] etc? well, all you do is post the item number in what you want. For Example, item 7336(rune kitesheild (h)), I put that into the public static int shields[] part. Then you compile, and login, and see if it worked. It should have worked, and your done! You can do that with any item! See how simple that was? Your finished!

Credits: [i]100% Me Unless somebody did this TUT before me.

The Fifth F.A.Q.
How Do I Make A Weapon Not Dissappear Anymore, Or To Have A Different Emote To It?
Read this!
Purpose: This tut will show you how to make any weapon in your server hit with a different emote, and it will also show you how to make the weapon not dissappear if it already does. Example: When you attack something, you dont see the weapon attack, you see your fists. (like d mace, d scmitty, and d hally in pimpscape)

Difficulty: 1

Assumed Knowledge: Just CTRL+F and copy and pasting.

Server Base: Pur3PkScape-Pimpscape source, will probably work with all of the sources.

Classes Modified: Client.java

If your weapons dissappear in your server, and to change emotes to any weapon:

Open your Client.java

Search for:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4747) // torags hammers { return 2068; }
You can add any weapon that dissapears. For example, see the 4747? That is the item ID number, so, if you want a dragon scmitty, copy the same thing under the last }, then edit 4747 to the item number of the weapon. For example, 6611, which is white scmitty. So edit 4747 to 6611. Then torags hammers to white scmitty. Then see that 2068? That is the emote the weapon uses. You can edit it to anything you want. You can edit it even to a barrows weapon! In my server, a dragon long is a flail! You see a dragon long, but hits like flail! For example, I have for my white scmitty in Pimpscape is this:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 6611) // white scmitty { return 3157; }
That is the emote it will use the one shown(3157) is the dragon 2h special.
If you do not see the weapon there, add it. If you add it, it will not dissappear in game.
You can search for any weapon, and change the emote.
Then save, and compile. Your done and the weapon don’t dissappear and it has a different emote!!
Credits:
100% by me unless someone else did it before me.
Enjoy this!
Thank you.

The Sixth F.A.Q.
How Do I Edit What XP I Get From Objects? (Specifically Ranged In Pimpscape)
Read this for help!

Purpose: To make range faster when you hit the targets.

Difficulty: 2-easy if you good coder, or just smart person=)

Assumed Knowledge: CTRL+C and CTRL+V (copying and pasting, and a brain:p)

Server Base: Pimpscape Source- Pur3PkScape.

Classes Modified: Client.java, and thats all!

Procedure
Open Client.java, and search for:case 2514: search it two times so you will see something like this: case 2514: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target and get ALOT of XP."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426);
Okay, when your there, delete all from case 2514(the target id number) all the way to the break;.
So, copy all that, and delete and place this into it: case 2514: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Thanks Zachary825 for fixing range."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((50000*playerLevel[4]), 4); addSkillXP((50000*playerLevel[18]), 18); addItem(1043, 10); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;
The 50000 means how much xp you get(really gives more but lol) you can edit it higher or lower, depending on what you like.
You can also do the same thing with dummies, hay bales, or doors. Basically anything if you know what your doing. Just right click the item(door, hay, or dummys) and go client and search case (item number of door etc here). Also you can edit the item it gives, the 1043 in the top if noted blue partyhars(10). You can also do this with prayer because its slow.
Thats it, I hope you enjoyed this tut by Zachary825.
Credits:
100% by Zachary825, UNLESS somebody had this tut before mine, if they did tell me your name and I will post it here.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:54:16 AM[/size][hr]enjoy

Read full topic
